description:
"Beastar"—a title awarded to beasts who prove their excellence through fighting inequality to unite carnivores and herbivores in an anthropomorphic animal society. Cherryton Academy has gone five years without one such leader. However, following the murder of an alpaca within the school boundaries, the growing tension between the different species poses a greater need for a Beastar to ensure peace and harmony.

When Louis, the prime candidate for this prestigious role, rejects the offer and leaves the academy, the student council declares to honor any student who captures the culprit of the aforementioned murder as Beastar. Meanwhile, Legoshi's sense of duty as a strong wolf who must protect the weak pushes him to investigate the incident. To further complicate his life, he struggles to manage his complex feelings for the white rabbit, Haru.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

Note: The first episode had an early delivery on Netflix Japan on January 5, 2021. The regular TV broadcast started on January 7, 2021.
synonyms: บีสตาร์ ภาค 2

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Noir
tags.description: Stylized as a cynical crime drama with low-key visuals.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Animal Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed animal or animal-like characters.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Vore
tags.description: Features a character being swallowed or swallowing another creature whole.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description:
[Website](https://tentenparuparu.tumblr.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/itaparu99)

She was born in Tokyo, Japan. Paru studied filmography in university, but was more interested in using pen and paper.

She is the daughter of the famous mangaka [Keisuke Itagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/99488/). 
 
She announced her marriage to a man from outside the industry on September 24th, 2023.

__[Website](https://www.yoasobi-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoasobi_staff) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

__Introduction:__
YOASOBI is a Japanese music duo consisting of vocaloid music producer Ayase and vocalist Ikura. The group have released four music videos, all of which are based on short stories posted on Monogatary, a website operated by Sony Music Japan.

__Biography:__
Both members of Yoasobi had active music careers prior to forming the group. Ayase gained a following on the video hosting site Niconico since his first upload on December 24, 2018, a song titled Sentensei Assault Girl. On November 23, 2019, he released an EP, Yuurei Tokyo, which reached third on iTunes' album chart. Rira Ikuta, performing under the name Ikura, had already released two EPs: Rerise in 2017 and Jukebox in 2019.

The first song released by the duo was "Yoru ni Kakeru", based on Mayo Hoshino's short story "Thanatos no Yuuwaku" hosted on Monogatary. The music video was released first on November 16, 2019, where it broke 10 million views in five months on YouTube as well as being popular on TikTok. It was subsequently released as a single on December 15, 2019, where it topped the popularity charts on both Spotify and Line Music. More than five months after its release, the single would top the Billboard Japan Hot 100 on June 1, 2020.

Following the success of their first release, on January 18, 2020, Yoasobi released their second single, "Ano Yume wo Nazotte", this time based on Souta Ishiki's "Yume no Shizuku to Hoshi no Hana". On April 20, 2020, Yoasobi released a teaser for their third single, "Halzion", which is based on Shunki Hashizume's "Soredemo, Happy End". "Halzion" marked the first time that Yoasobi collaborated with a professional novelist, whereas the first two were amateur writers. The single was released as a promotional project by Suntory to advertise their new energy drink named Zone. The single was official released on May 11, 2020.

__Members:__
- [Ayase](https://anilist.co/staff/198948/Ayase) (あやせ) – composer and arranger
- [Lilas Ikuta](https://anilist.co/staff/199392/) (幾田りら), better known as Ikura – vocalist and lyricist

Note: YOASOBI also releases an English Version of their songs after the initial release of the Japanese version.
[English Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR48NTfP0M0OtpJgD2obWAuQF8yk0_F77) 
[Japanese Playlist](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLR48NTfP0M0Nv3uFq7ka52rndi7_KJE41)

The founder and CEO of Studio ORANGE. He began as freelance CG creator in the game industry, before switching to anime with 'Zoids: Chaotic Century‘ in 1999. Founded Studio ORANGE in 2004 after working on Shoji Kawamori's 'Aquarion'. He has worked as a 3D/CGI Director and/or Producer for shows from Madhouse, Xebec, Doga Kobo, Kinema Citrus, and Passione.

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayase_0404) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayase_0404/) | [NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/86488427) | [Piapro](https://piapro.jp/Ayase_0404) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvpredjG93ifbCP1Y77JyFA)__

Ayase is a Japanese composer, lyricist, arranger and member of the music duo [YOASOBI](https://anilist.co/staff/194287/YOASOBI).

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/SoyCarlaCM) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/DubbCarlaCM) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/carlacmyo/)

A Mexican voice actress. She is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Twilight Sparkle in _My Little Pony_, Margaery Tyrell in _Game of Thrones_ and Stacey Dillsen in _Zoey 101_.
She's the recurring dub voice of Jennifer Lawrence, Kate Mara and Lily James.

She's the daughter of [Mario Castañeda](https://anilist.co/staff/96461/Mario-Castaeda) and [Rommy Mendoza](https://anilist.co/staff/184304/Rommy-Mendoza), as well as the older sister of [Arturo Castañeda](https://anilist.co/staff/117179/Arturo-Castaeda).
Hiroya Saitou is an episode director and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshi_kawajiri) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E5%B0%BB%E5%96%84%E6%98%AD) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoshiaki_Kawajiri)

Yoshiaki Kawajiri is an esteemed director and general anime creator.

After he graduated from high school in 1968, he worked as an animator at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) until it closed. He then founded [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) together with fellow former Mushi Pro employees, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/), [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Rintarou](https://anilist.co/staff/102305/). At Madhouse, he debuted as a director on 1984's [Lensman](https://anilist.co/anime/2770/), albeit still jointly with the more experienced [Kazunori Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/170070/). Kawajiri made his full-fledged directorial debuts in 1987, with [Wicked City](https://anilist.co/anime/1107/) and Running Man, the latter being a short film a part of an anthology collection, [Neo Tokyo](https://anilist.co/anime/1951/). Wicked City was originally meant to be a short film as well, but the producers were impressed enough in Kawajiri to let him turn it into a feature-length film. After these, Kawajiri directed [the third installment](https://anilist.co/anime/2998/) of Madhouse's adaptations of the highly acclaimed [Osamu Tezuka](https://anilist.co/staff/96938/) manga series, [Phoenix](https://anilist.co/manga/31325/).

Wicked City received critical and commercial success upon its release, giving Kawajiri more creative freedom. As a result of this he began writing the script for his own original film, [Ninja Scroll](https://anilist.co/anime/617/), a movie set in feudal Japan following a mercenary swordsman battling a team of ninjas with supernatural powers who are intent on overthrowing the Tokugawa shogunate. After the movie's international release, Kawajiri's status as a director received global recognition and he went on to direct multiple other works in the late '90s and early '00s.

In recent years, Kawajiri has taken a step back from directing, but has been guest appearing as a storyboard artist all over the industry.
